title: Developing Effective Teaching Strategies for Online Physical Education: A Practice-Based Case Study via Narrative Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational physical education theories and face-to-face class design, basic ICT utilization skills
context.additional_context: Focused on pre-service teachers analyzing core challenges of online physical education in technology-constrained environments and strengthening blended instruction design skills. Includes iterative improvement processes via smartphone-based learning tools and formative assessments.

learning_goals: Key issues in online physical education classes (e.g., reduced student engagement, limitations in practical skill assessment) can be analyzed using qualitative research methods.
Physical education teachers' online teaching experiences can be systematically organized by applying narrative analysis techniques.
A blended physical education lesson design plan feasible in limited technological environments (2â€“4 weeks) can be created.
Draft lesson designs can be improved based on peer feedback and formative assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
